Amaziiiiing. Séries, the cast , the end , the games , the captain really it is the best series I have watched this year. Really thanks to netflix for this amazing series, I hope another season is coming soon , Thank youuuu.

column4: A bad copy of Alice in Borderland
column5: I was honestly excited when I started the series, primarily because it was blowing up on social media. It did sound similar to Alice in Borderland (which had turned out be one my favourite series of all time), but I wanted to find out why it took off in the first place, when Alice in Borderland didn't receive nearly as much attention.Up until the tug-of-war episode, it seemed to be going okay. I think, for me, it peaked at the tug-of-war episode. But after that the whole series turned into a snooze fest. I mean, oh my god, it turned out to be so mind numbingly boring. And some areas were so blatantly copied from Alice in Borderland that I was shocked this series did not get slapped with a copyright. Ugh, such a waste of time. Honestly, if you've seen Alice in Borderland, don't bother watching Squid Game. The comparison is inevitable and it will leave behind a bitter taste.
Its a good series and I enjoyed it but the V. I. P s kinda ruins it. That's why I give it a 7, it was a really good series so I feel like they could have added something else then the V. I. P s.
Haven't enjoyed a series like this in a while. It's different and gets you instantly looked. The design and detail in the show is incredible, can't wait for season 2.

Very violent and disturbing series. I hoped I would understand the hype after pushing through to the end but also the ending is disappointing. You will watch desperate people doing anything for money, showing that you cannot trust anyone and at the end there's only 1 winner who won't change his life after being rich.

It's obvious that the idea of the games involving the lives of humans has appeared more than once in TV shows. Although the director has confirmed that the idea was planned many years ago, it's questionable that originality is one of its strengths. However, this series has made a different approach to the category, and for that reason I can understand its impact.The mixture of show and survival makes this story special. Involving emotions in tragic games transforms fear into treason, empathy into selfishness and hate into pain. Something that is usually complex to achieve. Social context plays an essential role in the series. Knowing the personal situations of the participants creates a vital link between the game and society. Best aspects? Feelings. Everything that this series could make you feel has a purpose and a reason. Almost every action of the characters is explainable in a certain way but also leaves you room for doubts and predictions about the next move. You won't get bored with the episodes, which is a priority among thrillers.Drawbacks? As I see it, the games ended faster than I was expecting. When you are risking your life, time seems to pass really slowly and in the series it happened all the opposite. For instance, I would have tried to enlarge the game scenes in the episodes. It's true that with this improvement your are risking the total timing, and perhaps it could become tiring, but that would be the best idea to take advantage of such a great plot. It would also have given the chance to extend a bit on the story of some characters that are relevant in the development of the series, which could be seen as one of the negative aspects, the lack of depth.All in all, it's such an excellent production, and I strongly recommend it without doubts.

It's not shockingly bad but nonetheless one of the worst thrillers I've ever seen. Not challenging and thrilling at all. The series tries to appear twisted with a playful scenery and costumes, which from the beginning just comes across as cheap, interchangeable and unoriginal. The plot rarely managed to build up emotions and tension - with the exception of episode 6. At some points, especially during the last few episodes, it seemed like they were trying really hard to make up as many "unpredictable" moments as possible. Which didn't work out well. One positive thing is the acting, which was very enjoyable consistently throughout the series.In summary, an overrated series with a poor storyline, a below average set design and good actors.

The concept and idea of the game is pretty cool, but there are too many holes in the plot to be able to enjoy it as much as I should.Why did the old man vote to end it after the first game, when he was behind it all?Where did all the prize money and money to keep staff and facilities etc come from? Did the VIP's really sponsor with this amount of cash?Who are these people working there accepting all of this?How can these competitions have lasted for over a decade without any of them getting the story out?How could the organ harvester do this, with the trap doors in special furnaces etc. Without it being known by the front man?The idea of deathly competitions with child games are quite thought out and brilliant, except that there are games that really are not child games.However when trying to create the reason and background for all of it, it just feels flat and like a quick fix.The VIP's acting/script is just as horrible and flat as the story behind it all.I can still recommend people to watch it though!It still is quite exciting at times and the relationships are pretty well thought out!
I love this show and binged it in 2 days just to find everyone on TikTok getting views on it from cringe videos. The show itself was amazing and is a much watch but avoid TikTok.

column4: Not the ending I would have expected
column5: I thought the only person who did not cheat would be the one who would win.But you kind of knew who it would be based on the focus on the one character but still! Also, I thought one of the gamblers could have been a previous winner, but maybe that's too easy?Still a good show, hoping the 2nd season just as good.

I finished. And San Ghi Khun is annoying me. He annoyed me in the start of show and in the end. He won, yes he lost a lot of dearest people, but anyway he has his daughter and like always he didn't choose his family and maybe last person who loves him. He go around and went on a game. My favourite series is squid game . This is a drama, Thriller,action Serie . It's a South Korean created and directed by Hwang dong Hyun . The original release was on September 17, 2021 . The leading characters are Jung Ho yeon (sea-byeok) , Oh young -soo (oh ii-nam) Jang deak-su (heo sung-tae) they are a player's in squid game the series have 9 episodes. The story is about 456 people indented. They playing children Game but if they lose they die . If one guy staying alive he win 45 billion wons. I think this series had a good potential . It's the only series I watched in my life and I love it.

I had been waiting for a month to watch this series with my partner together, I was very excited. Until last night we saw it and I am very disappointed 😐all the praises for this? Rotten 91? Really ?overrated. In my opinion, many people who had a positive opinion did not see movies and series like this. Of course, doing copying doesn't matter at all, if the execution is good. You know what I mean? You can copy but if you have a good performance why not, you can be the best. Unlike this series. :/1- In the first episode, I guessed the end of the series. I predicted everything, even the dialogues. See how cliché a series must be that I can predict so fast and not even a single one was wrong!2- The first episodes, when they got the policeman involved in the story, I liked it very much and I thought to myself that it was going to be interesting. But that didn't happen, the policeman struggles were not shown and there was not even any stress, and he was like Hitman! Or like an American spy Hollywood movie with an Indian theme ! Which had minor bugs.3- The first few episodes were very important for the backstory and story settings, but in these episodes, emotions were expressed in a dull way; Also, again, in a clichéd way, the characterization was mixed with melodrama if it could have been done more delicately, it would be great.And None of the characters grow up, the cliche bad and good always.4- there were not any backstory in some scenes where it must have a back story. There were Scenes where it could be symbolized, but no attention was paid to it. There were contradictions in some scenes and even in the story. Some flashback's timing were wrong and leaked the story further. The soundtrack was not good.5. The VIP section was awful; Apart from the bad acting, their voices and accents was awful and their script and dialogue were the worst part of the series.6. There are much better movies, series, mangas and even video games with this concept, maybe sometimes more creative and well-made. When you copy this concept, you have to present something different to be the best, unlike this series.The positive points if I want to say:1- they voluntarily had to choose to return to the game, it was a new thing and I liked it.2- great acting (except VIP)Now let me tell you the list:-battle royale 2000Most subsequent films and series were inspired by this.-3 percent.Most importantly, the same 3% (3%) series that Ive watched four years ago, and I certainly say that everyone should have seen this first.-Alice in Borderlandhunger gamescube 1997-Kaiji series-king's game,-would you rather,As the Gods Will,which also played the game green and red lights.-Escape room-Saw ,-Movie circle,the belko experiment,-Future Diary animeAnd battle game in 5 second (average)liar gameAnd other movies, series and manga.

It's a really deep message mixed with horror. I really loved it but it's tough to watch because it's so violent. If you're really empathetic it will mess with you. I think it's worth it tho, the message it's really important. I think it's a 10/10. Hope there's a second season. The actors are really good too, and the direction and effects.

column4: Good Plot, Very Addicted, Slightly Confused
column5: So I loved it, got very addicted to it and watched it in 2 days (could of done it in a day but I'm a working adult). I was very much into it through it all until the 5th game and onwards... the 5th game was just a bit of a mess and we all knew who was going to end up getting through. Then the last 2 episodes turned into quite a confusion when 2 of the leads die and then the main characters goes off into the world with obvious PTSD and a huge bank account. Rewind a year and he goes to meet the old man who is still alive (no shock there) and then he dies... cool story. Then he has some sort of middle aged mental breakdown, dyes his hair red, managed to break the girls brother out of a kids home and adopt him to the other guys mum and then finds out squid game is still going and goes all dolally. All in all... is there a season 2?

column4: Bingeable, but extremely overhyped and definitely not amazing
column5: Watched the show in 2 days, i must admit, it is in fact quite bingeable. However, I'm confused as to what i saw versus the reception by the audience, as "the most amazing and smart netflix-show ever created". Did we watch the same show?Overall, the show is decent. It's not original, which it is (hopefully) not trying to be, the execution is solid (for the most part). Some of the games were pretty interesting, s.a. The dalgona candy game or the squid game.However, the show lacks a lot of development, considering for how long its is, and has major plot problems: the storyline about dissection of the organs suddenly discontinued, i thought that was the whole point of these games? To gather a lot of bodies in order to dissect them and sell the organs. Nope, apparently not. Apparently, it's because some old man was bored on his death bead. In fact, nothing in the show was really explained, everyone's motivation seemed unclear and illogical in regard to what they were actually doing. I couldn't care for any of the characters, couldn't care for their death or their life or dynamic, couldn't care for the story of the two brothers, couldn't care for their interactions because they were all super super shallow.Conversations were super awkward, boring, dragged on for too long paired with a lot of severe and uncomfortable overacting by the actors. Tried to be extremely melodramatic in parts where it wasn't called for.Many other details didn't make sense or were just super unrealistic.The vips took the whole cake and ruined the show for good, but then the ending itself managed to suck even more.Well...i would definitely cut this show some slack, if it wasn't so well recieved. Come on guys, it's an okay show but definitely not the best Netflix show ever. People are calling it genius for foreshadowing the character's death when i could tell you 10 other shows that did it in the same way, as it is a common storytelling technique (and not original at that)I'm starting to think, people are pushing this show just because it is a Korean production, trying to make it out to be the best movie industry.Anyways, don't expect too much from this show, it's definitely overhyped and I'm glad i watched it early on, when it wasn't too popular yet.

It was truly are very good movie I like that you must also go and see it very very funny and very very dramatic.It contains several thrilling dramatic and Furious scenes across the full series it was just in amazing experience to watch this movie.
The advantages are all over. Let me talk about the most disgusting thing. Just like the director's former work which is "Silenced", the screen is full of sensationalism.

The series had my attention gripped tight from episodes 1 - 7. If I would have stopped right there I would have given it a 9/10, but then episodes 8 and 9 happen.I findd Gi-Hun being mad at Sang-Woo for sacrificing the glasses guy just a dumb way to create conflict between the characters. Gi-Hun betrays his friend because he saved his life??? Gi-Hun just doesn't work as a main character, at the very end he barely grows as a character. Imagine how great it would have been if Sang-Woo had won the squid game and then have to live with the fact that he killed his friend, it would have made for a very dark yet introspective finale.I have mixed feelings towards the old man being the host of the games, it kinda ruins the Gganbu scene, but at the same time I like how deranged and twisted was his justification for starting the games.Gi-Hun leaving the airport to stop the games instead of visiting his daughter is kinda lame. It just felt like a cheap sequel-bait ending. Season 2 will likely be the typical "small resistance group trying to take down the opressors", and I'm tired of stories taking the same turn over and over again.I get that I'm complaining just because thigs didn't end the way I wanted, but don't you think it would have been more interesting if we had gotten a darker and conclusive ending rather than the one we got, which I think is kinda generic?
After a long time i enjoy such a type of great show really good tv series 9/10. I hooked up to this tv series till the end really a great show like game of thrones.

Apart from other reviews, this webseries is good and we can watch it for once. They could've made it better.Because one may feel lag at some scenes while watching and the games that they play are a bit interesting. You can enjoy this once But don't keep your expectations high coz eveybody dont feel the same.Few cons apart YOU CAN GO FOR IT.

column4: Don't waste your time watching it
column5: Squid Game is the single worst tv show that I have ever watched. From the script to the direction, to the framing : everything is hideous. Really disappointed I wasted some time of my life watching it.PS : thanks for destroying Le Beau Danube Bleu.

This felt like yet another Korean remake of a popular Japanese TV show and/or movie (which itself was originally a manga) -- The movie in question is, "As The Gods Will" which came out in Japan back in 2014. Sure, they changed just enough so as to avoid any messy legal IP/copyright issues, but let's not pretend this movie is an original idea.I personally don't mind remakes, especially with foreign films being localized for a different audience (& culture). I just don't like it when try to pass off the remake as their original idea.As far as the show itself goes, it wasn't bad. I rather liked it, and liked the fact it was a TV show instead of a movie -- with a TV show you get more time to explore the world & characters. Acting was OK, cinematography was excellent and the writing wasn't bad either. I'd definitely recommend this movie to friends.

Definitely gives viewers a good look at what people who are struggling financially with major problems are willing to do for money as well as what people with too much money are willing to do for entertainment. Planned on writing how absolutely nauseating the VIP's were in their acting abilities but SO many people beat me to it. Seriously the dialogue was so awful I was actually getting irritated whenever they were on screen and the delivery would have sounded more human if it had been robotic voices. They manage to grate on your nerves while completely taking you out of the story.

column4: Brilliant until the last half hour
column5: Another series were it keeps you on your toes, but then the ending has you scratching your head. Why?????

Just awful. How on Earth can anyone rate this as even close to Westworld. If Squid game is a 9 then. Westworld is a 90! This is the Kings suit of clothing. I loved Parasite, it was utterly brilliant. This is embarrassing and very poor. The acting, the script, the subtitles are all of a student making their first feature. Netflix launched with Game of Cards and have followed up with countless classics (Dark is a breathtaking series), Sex Education is so entertaining. And the list goes on until we hit the buffers with Squid Game. I hate to be negative as 99% of my reviews on here are extremely positive. There is plenty more fish on Netflix leave this little sea creature in the depths of dystopian bilge.

column4: A bad serries but not that bad for being just entertained
column5: 1. Too many plot holes2. No character development3. Might be visually entertaining4. A potentially good stroy5. An absolutely weak scenario6. Mediocre acting7. Predictable8. One of the worst endings ever9. Too cliché10. Mostly too rediculous.
Slow developing and boring story, boring actors that over-react. Squid Game is just over-hyped. Would not recommend wasting your time.

It was very good and thrilling at the beginning, but on episode 6 I noticed how long the dialogues and things were taking and I actually fell asleep because it was tedious. For some reason I didn't even get emotional on that episode, just felt like some things didn't even make sense.From that on, I was more interested on the police officer's plot than actually the games. And this is another thing that didn't even get closure. If you're not certain there'll be another season, you can't just let things unfinished.The ending didn't get me and somethings didn't make sense (like that hair?). It was obvious his mother would be dead by the time he got home, I knew it since episode 2.There are some CLEAR nods (maybe even copy?) to The Hunger Games movies, such as the song that is played to the characters (even though it's a classic song, it was very clearly copying the Panem Anthem idea), the score soundtrack of the series while the game is going on (very similar to the movies), even some camera shots and the VIPS watching the games and betting on players. Even the ending was similar, only it wasn't a Peeta the second contestant.It was an ok show, it would be more fun to watch if the dialogues were more direct and things happened faster.

I like the series but feel so disappointed with the ending. He earned so much money and instead of helping his family and daughter, he wants to become Batman and save the world. I am super disappointed.
Acting 3/10. Story 1/10. Visuals 6/10. Feels like a B rated holywood movie from the 80s. Is it reddit or 4chan behind the hype again?
If you can get past the dubbing, this is a brilliant nail biter...unlike anything I have seen before...I would HIGHLY recommend.

It's watchable but i really don't get from where it got so much good reviews... The concept is nothing new, totally predictable, overloaded with all stereotypes... VERY AVERAGE SERIES. That's it!I can only imagine people having discussions about it and extrapolate to human behaviors, what they would do in same situation or full with theories on how money controls our lives etc pfffffffff... boring!!!I watched it but with my finger constantly on the +10 sec...
Watch Anime like Kaiji or Gambling Emperor Zero and you find way smartes mindgames. Those squid games are just cheap and easy with no real solution behind it.Just a ripoff.

Parasite, Saw, Hunter X Hunter, Cube, Black Mirror, The Platform, Oldboy... Takeshi's Castle?An unexpected mix of all my favourite things - Squid Game is the best thing I've watched this year.An intriguing premise that actually delivers. I went in with no expectations and was blown away!
I loved it. Right up to the vips, which were pathetic, however didn't ruin the show too much.Well worth the binge on a Saturday night.
This show is a masterpiece, very deep in many aspects, the only negative aspect are the VIP's.
One of the very few TV series which I watched in one go. Fantastic concept, great acting and superb screen play makes it one of the classic TV show of all times.

column4: The running man and The long walk in one deeir
column5: If I had not read the 2 books from the 1960' and 1970' by Stephen King, I would have watched the serie with different eyes.But I have read both novels. . So, it's a good serie, that shows what people are willing to do for money. If their life sucks. It shows how the rich people take advantage of the misery of the poor.

It is terrifying how cristophobia (attacks on the Christian faith and on Christians) is one of the main banners of the New Left in the world and of a large part of the media that promote these ideologies. This series makes several subtle attacks on Christians, trying to promote hatred and anger against followers of the Christian faith. One of the Christian characters is a hypocritical speaker, prays to try to cover the crimes he commits, and the series shows several negative characteristics of this character as if they were common to all Christians. In another situation, a character's father is a practicing Christian but beats his wife every day and then prays, until one day he kills the woman. There are several subtle attacks on the Christian faith, always in a derogatory and hateful view.

column4: I really don't understand why people have gone crazy with this!
column5: This series is just another average one. Nothing less nothing more!And I am explaining:1) NOT original at all. Several movies had as the main idea a game of life and death. Also a recent Japanese series (Alice in borderland) has almost the exact same idea.2) totally predictable even for a six years old.3) Overdramatic without any reason using of course too much of the respective music.4) The acting was almost ridiculous and almost making you laugh instead of feeling what the creator thought you should feel.AND PEOPLE for god sake don't fall for marketing tricks, promotions and trendy stuff.There are so many more (countless) shows and series way much better than this that deserve your time. STOP being sheep and just doing something just because is viral.And i am saying all these after i have watched about 200-300 TV shows and Series and countless movies and not only that trendy ones!Thank you for your attention.(Sorry for my possibly bad English)
Everything about this was great except for the VIPs. The writing and acting is so atrocious. We could have have done with them speaking at all.

column4: All players chose to play on their own...
column5: What about the first 200+ casualities on the first game who didn't know they were going to die if they participate? I think the old man was kind of an ass and wasn't really a chaotic neutral character they tried to portray him to be at the end.Overall, good show.

column4: Perfect in every way except for the vips.
column5: This serie was mindblowing but the vips actwork was so terrible i cant give it a 10. Thankfully vips were not a major part of the serie.

The show is great with strong acting from everyone except the VIPs. Gosh!... I don't know if the english actors they get are wannabe actors who live in Korea or what but for all the Korean dramas I've seen the english actors are the worst. The Pakistani actor was top notch. Give him a few more roles in Korea please. The emotion was right there and his limited Korean was realistic for the role.
I give 1 star for the idea. The rest is media hype. Very superficial and easily predictable. You can spend your time better.

This series is by no means a "must watch". All characters except for the main protagonist fall flat. I must say that the acting of Hoyen Jung is not good. All she does is staring grimly into the void.Up until the third game, the series was interesting to watch, if you like the survival/battle royal genre. However, don't expect any unpredictable events. Everything after that just felt trashy with artificial emotions. Even the story around the games, with the cop and the frontman could have been sooo much deeper. Why did the winner of the 2015 games become the frontman? Why was there a bomb introduced? How did the organ trafficking have any impact on the story? Why did noone notice the murals in the sleeping room showed all the games? The list goes on...The worst thing by far was the cringeworthy acting by the VIPs. I have to say, it is actually an achievement to be acting so bad, even though you wear a mask and all you have to do is sit on a couch. I mean, a sixty-nine joke, really? Come on.Any theorycrafting which is done now is because of the bad writing. I can totally understand why the script was rejected before so many times.

column4: It is way under my expectation
column5: I have to say after watching the trailer, I immediately saved this series to my watch list and could not wait until it is out.However, maybe due to my high expectation I was quite disappointed after finishing the 1st season on one run. Believe me, I'm a sucker for this kind of genre so I'm looking for interesting plot, great games and unpredictable twists. If you're the same as me, the series will not deliver these. I found some parts are redundant with unnecessary overacting, I had to skip plenty times. The plot is quite boring for me compared to other survival-game series. But, I cannot deny the cinematography is great.If you have some time to kill, it still brings you some entertainment. Keep your expectation lower to enjoy it more if possible.
I liked it , but it was boring sometimes and the actores whose spoke English was badIt should be more suspense.

column4: Extremely depicted on the corrupted desire of capital
column5: Squid game is a conventional drama which is dipicted on living experience of human being addicted to capitality. The various games in the drama is showing a testimony that people are living for.People.

+ brilliant storyline, keeps you gripped until the end+ great acting from the main actors+ dubbed in English was fine and easy to follow, subtitles well done too+ really got attached to the characters, got a bit emotional in parts!left me with a lot of questions at the end of the seriesfound the ending a little frustrating, maybe I didn't understand it?!

Good writing, poor message. Some notable plot holes but nothing ruins it more than a main character who signs up for the games, sees death, is allowed to leave and then comes back to play only to blame other people for the fates of the fallen players. The show makes the people who understand what the games are out to be villains. And of course the foolish, self righteous, hypocrite wins it all.

If you are looking for a show with amazing performers (except the vip) then you need to watch squid game. Episode 6 is heart breaking. A tv show has yet to make me cry yet this one did. If I could give another standing ovation then I would.

column4: My first korean drama and damn it's good as hell.

column4: One of the best original shows to come out!!
column5: From the start to finish, the show is an emotional roller coaster. Full of mystery and suspense. Only downside I'd say is that, due to nature of the show, we had an idea who would win. All main characters were quickly realised and we had a expectation that who'd make it. Not as suspenseful as perhaps Game of thrones. I mean I know its only 9 part show and the show runner had no idea where it would go.It's a crime that it's been sitting on shelf for 12 years before someone gave it a GREEN LIGHT. I mean we could have been on season 12 or perhaps it would have ended by now.I personally can't wait for season 2.
The dialogue is poor. I knew who will die and who will win. It's really an overrated series I recommend to watch D. P it's much better.

In our present day there is reality shows like survivor looks like the squid game but not killing but I'm surr soon we will see the real squid game in our live.The serie is very good and attractive. I like it.

The show is so bland! I don't even know where to start. The acting is bad, and the characters do not make sense at the time. There is no depth whatsoever, there is nothing between the lines and the story doesn't add up. I really hope the rating would fall below 7/10 since this doesn't make any sense.
Awesome show couldn't stop watching it. The way everyone gets scared loves the lady and the gangster always arguing. Sad part when the marbles were replaced with stones.

column4: What a show! I cannot fault it.
column5: I am absolutely blown away by this show - thankfully not in the red light, green light sense. I wish I could wipe it from my mind just to experience it all over again.The writing is impeccable from start to finish, the characters, the pace, the TENSION that the writers create make for a rollercoaster viewing. I screamed, I cried, I cringed, I covered my face but still watched through my hands because honestly you can not look away while watching this show. It is so clever yet so simplistic in it's storytelling. You will adore some characters and sympathise with some of the darker characters once you learn more about them.I cannot fault it. Even the VIPs that everyone is talking about did not take away from the action for me. They were vile but the stakes in the episode are so high you won't really care.Honestly I haven't been this enthralled and excited about a show since I was a teenager going to watch Catching Fire in the cinema.If gory things aren't your cup of tea then be warned, but I wouldn't miss out on this show because of that.

column4: Maybe don't watch it in public
column5: It's the twist no one wanted. But I still thought it was a very interesting season. I watched most of it on planes and would not recommend that, I felt bad for the passengers all around me.
My first review... you will not regret watching this as fans of both thrillers and korean dramas... this film really has outdone itself.

This was a disappointment, coming with high hopes from all the buzz about it and previous experience with Korean drama with greats like Parasite...The ideas are great and promising, yet the bad script brought it really down, the script describes everything and doesn't really leave room for you to figure it out on your own; as well as being full of badly written cliches. I don't mind a cliche but at least make an effort to not make it seem like one.The newly introduced characters in episode 7 were the most atrocious addition, their acting and lines were beyond horrible that I thought I was watching a high school production.An overall meh...
The VIP's were, as many said before, horrible actors.
Don't know if there will be a second season. The end for the first one does not have the same value as the rest of the series.

Acting very hit or miss. Ending kinda wack. Vip scenes were extremely cringey and poorly done. Plot holes here and there. Things that are really unbelievable like 2 people getting away with using a lighter in the honeycomb game.
All the tv makers should benchmark their creativity with this. We are hungry for new out of the box script with good acting.

column4: Haven't been this hooked in a while
column5: This series hooked me in fast. My husband and I binged the series in two days. It showed the dark side of human desperation all while somehow being relatable regardless of your status in this world. Everyone makes it a point to mention the VIP's, which yes the acting was poor, but it didn't tarnish the rest of the show. I won't say too much more other than the fact I'm pissed I cried the way I did over that old man lmao bamboozled.
Awesome and I like you. Best Series I have been right now.
Terrible acting, terrible scenario. I couldn't finish the first episode. Simply waste of money and time.
Simply i enjoyed every single minute in the magnificent series.

column4: Entertaining but don't understand the hype
column5: So there's no denying that this is an entertaining show but come on people - what's all this hype about?!? The storyline itself is fairly unoriginal - although different...there are other movies based on a similar story (people playing a game against each other, resulting in death, secret societies, delving into humanities primal response to self-preservation etc.) and for the most part I found it totally predictable! Again - don't get me wrong...I enjoyed it - it was easy watching and a pleasant enough weekend binge but I genuinely do not understand the hype...there are far greater shows that deserve more credit than this. So in conclusion - watch it for yourself...but don't expect it to be mind-blowing.P.s. The dubbing is awful - please watch it in Korean with subtitles...much, much better!

I confess to watching every episode before realizing the characters were an overused, worn-out personality mix, the plot was predictable and the hundreds of assassination style killings were the central plot driver.But still part me enjoyed the novelty, the exposure of human fragilities and the bright color sets and costuming.The product is not that great, the remarkable popularity might be explained by the economic desperation many of us feel right now and perhaps it taps into a growing resentment toward the financial elite.

column4: It got me awestruck for a moment but it got sunk in the plotholes.
column5: Loved the first few episodes. I slept late on a working night just to watch it in a single go.The plotholes though were definitely trying to sink this Titanic in the end.1. The Cop story -I can't digest that he could so easily swoop the whole facility and got caught on a distant island instead.The morse code thing, what was is about?He had sent proofs about the games to the police via his super long-lasting iphone but still nobody does anything for an year?So basically his character development goes in vain. Gets killed by his own brother and couldn't do anything about the game.2. At the end, the three finalists had been given one knife each. What if 2 people would have got killed? If yes, there would have been a winner without even playing the last game. What's the point of such scheduling, planning and discipline. It doesn't make sense.3. The glass shattering scene at the end of the game was totally unnecessary and senseless. What if they killed all their participants unknowingly? There would be no games at all, no winner?4. VIPs were totally unnecessary. They didn't even show their betting properly. After all, at the end it turns it was all for fun but we never saw that enthusiastic gambling from the vips.There are more but I guess I can remember this much only as of now.

Thank god for the 15 second skip button, I found this show utterly predictable, the over acting is atrocious, I love Asian Kung fu films this is just terrible acting, the only part I didn't pick was 001, I'll never watch another Korean film again.

column4: Nice show, but not entirely beliavable
column5: The show was OK, but the storyline about the detective was just too much. I mean, He just happened to be passing by when the main character was reporting the games to the police. He was JUST following the main character the day he returned to the games. He curiously had a disappeared brother that won a few games before this one. He should have been caught like a thousand times for being sloppy. And finally the brother being the leader was just ridiculous.
One of the best korean show i had ever seen,i hope there' second season of it , love it..
Real suspense thriller. Great show. Exciting from start to finish. An international hit. Perhaps a season 2 ??? Would be awesome. South Korea has produced a tremendous television show.
This show was truly one-of-a-kind. I adore everything about it. One of my current favourite series, and I'm looking forward to the second season.

My kids on my back to watch it, so watched first episode, bit over the top for me and didn't think much of the first episode, but then watched the second and I got hooked, watched the whole series, this not perfect but bloody close, it got me in and I enjoyed the first season allot so much I'm watching it again. I can see why it is so popular and now I have to wait for second season. Really worth watching but warning allot of blood and gore.

Loads of reviews detailing the series so won't bother going in to that. What Netflix needs to do is to get the director to re-edit the series. Remove the VIPs, the doctor, organ trafficking and missing police brother storyline. Keep it really tight on the games and the contenders. Reduce it to just 5 or 6 episodes. Call it Squid Game: Redux or something. Would be perfect.
But the VIPs were CRINGE!Great acting, great story, great twists!

column4: Fantastic - watch it in Korean as well
column5: I really really enjoyed this. The acting from the Korean actors was incredible, all of them were brilliant and so believable. All the interactions between the players in the early games were so great, especially Gi-Hun, Ming-Wae and Sang-Woo. Yes the English actors were crap but it didn't really detract from it, if anything it made them more creepy and added to the atmosphere that they saw themselves as Gods.Don't want to spoil it but honestly it's so worth a watch. As awful as it is, it highlights the terrible things that possibly happen in the world.

This is everything you want from a TV-Series. Drama, Thriller, Entertainment, good acting for a TV series and of course very good storyline.The Koreans never seem to disappoint when it comes to Drama/Thrillers. There's always something you don't expect that happens at some time in the movie/series that you just are left speechless.If Wes Anderson would have made a Thriller Tv Series, I think it would've pretty much looked like this one, haha. I liked the cameras, the scenes where it looks like an animation movie (e.g. The stairs), and most of all the symmetry.The actors who play the VIPs are extremely bad at acting. I mean, what the hell? A show this great, ruined by only 4-5 bad secondary actors.All in all, I would give 9 out of 10 to this amazing production. Would recommend to anyone.

column4: Very hypocritical and not a REAL death-game show
column5: I don't know why the show gets so much praise internationally. I mean overall it's a really bingeable show, but there's really nothing much aside from that. In my country, the show receives so many polarized comments, with people either loving it badly or hating it with passion.The game master said that the game is created so that those mistreated in the outside world will be treated equally in the game, and yet the master himself did not get shot when he lost the game (voluntarily or not). In the "walking on glass" game, when one candidate knew how to tell tempered glass from normal glass, the front man turned off all the lights just to make the game more entertaining to the VIPs, effectively rendering the poor man unable to use his skills. I guess it's still much advantageous to be rich and powerful even in the so-called equal game, hah?The main character is horrible. He's a loser with no character development throughout the movie. He's described as a person that has so much compassion and empathy with others, yet in the end he didn't even bother visiting his daughter in the US - all because of some nonsense triggering comments from the front man. And gosh he wouldn't even have kept his promise to the North Korean defecting girl to take care of her brother had it not been for the call from the organizer. Such a f*cked-up man who I have no sympathy for.There are so many other flaws in the movie that I don't have time to bother mentioning. All in all, a movie with good intentions and palatable cinematography, but horrendous execution. If you like death-game shows, better watch Alice in Borderland, Jinrou Game, the Incite Mill, Liar Game, or many that actually make you use your brain to figure out how to escape your ill-fated situation and don't annoy you with hypocritical mouthings.

column4: Fun to watch. Don't get why all the memes and media coverage.
column5: The show is fun to watch and serves its purpose, entertain you.As for the plot there are several wholes and mistakes, and even things that do not get anywhere. But it's interesting and the character development is good.Now the worst part, the VIPs. Worst actors ever. Poorly executed and maybe poorly written? I can't imagine directing and seeing that performance and allowing it to make the cut.

column4: This show is worth your time!!!
column5: Squid game is an excellent show that piques your interest from the get-go. They slowly build up the story and once you understand what happens with the people who lose the game; you're hooked.If you have the eye of a detective (like me), then you'll know from the first game that the old man is involved in some way and is not just a player.The 4th game has a lot of twists and is a rollercoaster of emotions. This episode will make even the toughest people cry.I definitely recommend this show.

I watched the series in german sync. I cannot understand the bad reviews about the VIPs. In the german sync version they speak english to underline the international connection to the "Squid game". Of course some of them are not native speakers and the fact, that they all wear masks makes it even harder to act, but keep in mind that this is a korean production and the budget was definitely litmited for these charakters.

column4: To everyone complaining about the VIP acting
column5: In my opinion they played so ridiculously bad to portrait what they think about the Americans and to mock them with their bad jokes. Their cast was really good and i dont think they just didn't get the right actors to play the Americans.

Series is ok. But the end is very bad. They could made something different. It's looked like they lost idea how to finish the season. If they wanted to make some room for the season 2 the could be more creative.

This is honestly the best series i have ever watched i finished it in one night and now i cant stop thinking about it everything about it is perfect the storyline the events are not exepcted a lot of plot twists i have every single emotion watching this stress anxiety anger happy and i mean it i will never regret watching it good job.

column4: It's good but please no need to s2
column5: So fas so good but please Netflix there is no need to season 2 you will ruined it.
IT IS VERY BIG AND IS FROM KOREA.... FANTASTIC.... ONE BIG BANG AT YOUR STOMACH...

I really didn't expect that much when I started to watch this serie. I finaly binged it and loved it. Got sticked in front of the screen. I really liked the scenario and the acting. A very surprising serie that I suggest you to watch. Be aware however, this is brutal visualy and emotionaly.

column4: AMAZING SOCIAL COMMENTARY! We, the viewers, are the real VIPs!
column5: Criticize the VIPs all you want, but don't ding the show for the VIP's bad acting, poor scripts, and being terribly out of place altogether. I believe all of that is intentional. We, as viewers of the show, are just like the VIPs. We are paying for our Netflix subscriptions to fund the show's production, and watching this "game" fold out for our entertainment. It's no wonder these VIPs purposefully speak English.If you're disgusted by the VIPs (and hopefully most of us are), then you should be disgusted by ourselves and our roles in society.

column4: Good idea but scenario is disappointing
column5: It is hard to explain my thought without spoilers but I have to do this, cause rating of Squid Game is so good. You won't see any drama in here. Main characters will do things just because the script writer wanted to do so but you won't understand motivation of them. Especially motivation of main hero. Director, operators, editors, costume guys and other people involved in Squid Game production did a pretty good job but script writer ruined everything. Watch this ably as pop-corn movie because there's no character design in it, no interesting twists, no drama - nothing.
There is no need to spend time on such a predictable series.

I think the general idea and scenario were really good. The characters and actors had done great work but I think there was too much violence and blood in the episodes.Besides that, there were some unrealistic events during the episodes like for example:when the policeman went to the island hiding under the van. Like common how's that even possible?! Which part under the car he was holding to it ?!please tell me also how did the phone Battery hold for more than 5 days ?!And there are more and more of that unrealistic events.In general, it's was a great serious and it deserves watching but the blood, violence and the unrealistic events might ruin it a little bit.
Great start with no worthwhile return. Lat episodes waste time and give no value to end. Absolutely stupid show.
A really good series its only need better writing, think carefully about the quotes, for the next season it will be epic if it was in Spain with Spanish actors.

column4: Cant miss premise that was lost in translation
column5: Humans vs humans is a no brainer for writers. Be it Hunger Games, 13, The Hunt, or Surviving the Game, I as well as others, for what ever reason, are going to watch...in spite of the quality.My first concern was the acting, not the actors ability, but them acting like Koreans. Are Koreans usually this giddy and overly reactive in certain situations? The main character at the horserace or with his daughter was uncomfortable to watch, but it could be it didnt translate well. As for the VIP, a lot of criticism has been on their acting, but does it matter since the Korean version would have translated there words for them? If so, they could have been spouting gibberish and the subtitles for the Korean audience would have remedied that easily.As with the aforementioned films, this one lacks a punch ending. Writers just dont seem to find a ending that is as strong as the beginning. The last game had none of the emotional power and cleverness of the prior ones. The 5th left something to be desired also, except to resolve an issue between two characters.I suffered through all of my criticisms, and you should as well. It is just such a strong idea, wish someone could deliver an ending.
Would give it 10 if it ended with an ending.Please don't ruin this with a second season.

I don't know why people hype this up so much. Story is boring and predictable.The VIPs were bad actors, and the other characters were mostly annoying.As said in my first sentence I can't seem to understand why people like this so much and that it is rated an 8.3..
Very good. Worth watching, can't wait for season 2.
Dub was good. Awesome show, give it a watch it was a lot of fun.
There is no need for an actual review. Just watch this piece of art.

column4: One of the best movie of this kind
column5: Plot, visuals, acts, scale... every elements were so well prepared and harmonized. The characters have distinct personalities and are very interesting.According to the characteristics of each stage of the survival game, the appearances of the characters collide and gather whenever they encounter in extreme situations. All those factors fit each other amazingly well. Each character also represents an aspect of society issue or shape of human beings.This movie is not only giving you entertainment, but also throw questions about matter of humanity, morals, strategy, social issues, family and the weight of life & death.There is no scene to skip.

My God the actors who potrayed the VIP people cannot act. I cringed everytime they said a line. It felt like they were just reading them. Even the intonation was off. It was like when we were kids and had to read a play in class and we exagerated the intonation. Terrible, just awful.
Very slow, I expected it to catch me from chapter one and in the middle I stopped it to finish it another day. The idea is not bad but in general it is not what I expected.

Everything becomes boring after a point"The goal is not to make lot of money but after making lots n lots is not to get bore while enjoying the material thingsWhat a series man The bestest series everI so wanted Sae byeok to win the prize money.
Unbelievably good. A must watch. One of the best things to come out of Netflix.
I was talking to Cahir about it lastnight. Concept is decent and can see why it's popular but the dialog in the show is so stupid! It's like they're forcing lines to cover up the Korean lip sync.

I really wish at the end, the frontman was just Mr Beast. Seems like something he would do just to mix it up a bit.All seriousness aside, this is a real thrill ride with some absolutely brutal moments and really shows the lengths people go to stay alive. Greed, guilt, remorse, relief and anger are just a handful of the emotions shown by the cast.Very thought provoking and would highly recommend to anyone.

This series reminded me of Alice in Borderland which some web pages suggest you to watch after finishing this series. I have never written a review about Alice in Borderland by i am writing about this since its was better than the Japanese series which was based on manga and anime (they didn't finish the anime though).Now back to this series. Personally i am skeptic to Korean shows since i watch only western Hollywood movies and series but i gotta say here the Koreans surpassed the Americans way better just as they did with Oldboy(2001) which was copied by Hollywood in Oldboy(2013) which stars Josh Brolin (the guy wtho plays Thanos) and with the movie Miracle in Cell Number 7 that the Turkish stole and made a Netflix movie of their own.I call it the dream of all horror fans since every horror fan likes movies like Nine Dead, The Unknown, Saw 2, The Killing Room, Fermats Room, Cube, FunHouse, The Platform and most importantly the movie Would You Rather (2012).Its the same like Would You Rather with characters who suffer from debts and have desperate ways of living along with the lack of the opportunities to breakthrough and pay their debts which if they do not they risk their internal organs. The beauty of the show is that the participants participate willingly in the deadly contests. No one forces them to do but they do it with their own free will. Its more elaborted than Would You Rather when we get to see the management, the ranks of the guards and the officials, how the system works etc....If you like these kinds of horror shows and you are addicted to them there is no better one than this.
It's rare I get into tv shows but gave this a try as a lot of people had recommended it. It's absolutely superb, gripping from start to finish.

I find the logic/reason behind the death games is very weak. Otherwise the thrills, exitment, acting desighn all are quete good. But for the ending and the logic i give the rating 6 in overall. If their a strong logic behind this games i wpuld give it to 9.

Before 4th game there are 39 players. The madwoman can't find anyone to play with and they stay to play 38.They are divided into pairs and so there are 19 dead and 19 comeback and continue in game 5.Then those 19+ crazy woman witch is waiting for them, they had to be 20, not 17 as they showed is episode 7 at the beginning.3 players are lost !!!?

column4: One of the best shows on netflix. Period!
column5: Finally Netflix has created a masterpiece. No doubt about that. If you are a lover of the purge series,and can withstand a bit of violence and blood,mixed with human emotions and hard truths,this series is tailor made for you. You wont be able to stop after watching the first episode,you can bet on that. Excellent thriller!

column4: Korean cinema is still overall immature and overhyped
column5: As a Korean-American who is a fan of cinema, Korean film and television still has a long way to go overall. There are a few standout directors (Bong Joon Ho and. Park Chan Wook immediately come to mind), but in general-as demonstrated in Squid Game-Korean cinema is prone to over-dramatization, reducing character to two dimensional caricatures, very obvious and amateur plot holes among other glaring faults that take away from the effect and value of the film. The plot is engaging to be sure, but the execution prevents me from feeling fully invested in the emotional turmoil of the characters.Decent series overall but not at all deserving of whatever hype it's received.

column4: After weeks i still can't forget about this show !
column5: I never reviewed a movei or show before on IMDB, but this show made me wanna do it, because its this show is just beautifull, the actors are sooo great at acting, the show is just a perfectiongo and watch it goddammit.
Was expecting a typical graphic Korean movie... Turned out the movie was engaging with a nice twist to the ending. Highly recommended!

column4: All that for a trope we've seen over and over again
column5: The show's moral is "the poor and rich are similar". The poor being the good guys and the rich being the bad guys. As reasonable as the trope is, this one is executed terribly. Let's call is this a "Game of Thrones" ending: I was enthralled until the 7th episode and then it was garbage.

We've seen every element of this before. My wife and I sat here predicting how every single scene would play out. The acting, while carried by a few good performances, was uninspiring and the lack of character development made it hard to care for the fates of anyone in the show. More enjoyment came from retranslating the poor subtitles than actually following the story.
Yes, Westworld. Really. Westworld? Yes, that American show. Westworld. Yes, Westworld!? !!? It started like a Western? Yes. Then kinda got like The Matrix? Yes. Sort of. Ah, WESTWORLD!!!!!ButBetter.

The thing I love about this series is the game was designed or held by a normal people. That what makes the games has flaws, so when some of the contestants cheated, it makes sense for the pink guard didn't noticed since they're also normal people.

Really nice idea, but I think it would've worked better as a movie. Maybe even a movie series? Even in 9 episodes I didn't get that bond with the characters, so I would've just leave some out. I think there was a lot of unnecessary scenes for such a short season. I didn't really see the policeman finding his brother very necessary for example. The old man was really a key for this one, he really saved the whole series at the end. All in all this movie still gets 6/10 because of the great casting, visuals, set and the idea.

column4: Great acting and story apart from the Skyrim npcs
column5: The show has a lot going for it, most of is positive until the VIPs come in to play. Their acting and script are horrible. To me, they came across as Skyrim NPCs. Apart from this the series is super solid and one of the best to watch at the moment. Great work!

I don't have a lot to say about it.. Acting 1/10 and story 2/10. So overrated series. Not really good actors and slow movie. I was waiting to see if it was going to be some twist but the way they directed this series was so wrong.

Great Korean actors, the main ones performance impeccable. Couldn't stop watching. Watched the nine hours series in one weekend. Yeah the VIP performance sucks but i guess they have stored it for the next seasons. Korean horror movies, train to busan, parasite, squid game rocks!

column4: Great show with a horrible ending
column5: I'm going to keep this short but this show was going amazing right up until the vip episode where it began to crumble to pieces. The plot and the high school theater level acting of the vips made me want to turn off the episode. I still don't think that was worse than the last episode though the ending was way too predictable and I hated what they did with the old man. Overall a good show but they definitely could've wrapped it up better.

The idea is somewhat interesting but has many unrealistic elements. Yes, it is a fiction, but even in a fiction people's reactions must be realistic. You can watch the show if you have nothing better to do.
One of the best asian series. The subject is interesting but i cannot see a good continuity.
Do yourself a big favor and listen to the Korean audio with subtitles. The voice over dialog does t do the show any justice. Very enjoyable. Has a Parasite meet Maze Runner type of feel.

Slow at times, but intense and engaging throughout. Acting was on point and I loved how they mixed different elements of society and human behavior.The only issue was the VIPs. Quite the buzz kill in terms of acting and overall performance. They didn't fit in there they way they should. Casting failGive it a watch peeps!

Interesting premise. Characters are flawed however they are not people you would get behind. I'm supposed to feel sorry for this guy who just stole from his elderly mother to gamble? And feel bad for him when he is mugged?Also watching in English with subtitles. The dubbed voices are laughable. Netflix should've put an usher behind the voice actors for the English Dub.Not as gory as everyone is saying it is. And not many characters to get behind. It's well shot and the acting is good however the story and characters make it generic like things before it Saw, Escape room, Hostel etc.

Firstly, I want to address the VIP criticism. I honestly hated the VIPs too, but considering how breathtakingly good the acting was by EVERYONE involved, I think their over the top, cringe inducing acting was purposeful. You're SUPPOSED to loathe them, and they are meant to be insufferable and cold.With that out of the way, without spoiling anything, I think that the intentionality behind every shot, every line, and the beautiful sets was unfathomably great. I felt every emotion along this ride of a show and have never "ugly cried" during any movie or show in my life like I did with Squid Game. In my opinion, this is the best show or movie I have ever seen and I've been recommending it to everyone. This is the first review I've ever submitted to IMDB; I went out of my way to write it because I was so moved by this series.I'm hoping for another season and am dying to learn more about so many things going on at the end. Luckily, the rewatchability of this show is of the highest degree due to the many Easter eggs and intentionally placed foreshadowing throughout. This show deserves every bit of recognition it's received and then some. If you're on the fence about watching this show, WATCH IT!

column4: A diamond in the rough from Korea.
column5: Korean Hunger Games with better acting and much more relatable themes. The plot allegory focuses on the rampant exploitation of poor and desperate people, with the initial invitation to play the game and everything that follows appealing to their need to clear debts. This soon becomes about something much bigger and darker. Not for the squeamish.No spoilers, but I will say I'm a vehement anti-binger when it comes to my viewing habits. In the 10-odd hour runtime of this series, though, I stopped only to sleep and make a chicken wrap.

column4: Terrible acting and many plot holes
column5: This series is highly overrated. The acting is amateur like, too much drama, drags for way too long, and the story has many plot holes that are difficult to overlook. I don't understand how this series got so popular... I understand that a lot may be lost in translation but really this is a cheap try to make something that keeps you hooked but has no substance at all.

People are overestimating this series in a way never seen before, it's just an average series,basically this series takes several movies and series and mixes them all together, the only game that's really interesting to watch is the first one.

column4: Parasite meets Hunger Games meets Hostel meets The Cube
column5: This series really does not add anything new for us who've seen it all. Yes, it's addictive, but a disappointing end of the season, and while I can imagine how the next and hopefully final season is going to look like, I'm not going to invest more time in it.I don't know about how the Korean script is like, but the American parts is below par.If you've watched the movies I've listed in the title, don't bother to watch this series.
..and bad acting 😫 never have i seen a serie as bad as this one.. like i sad: ridiculous!I dont know why people are so exsided, its a really stupid story..

column4: A good start with disappointing ending and a useless MC.
column5: The show started good gor the couole of episodes but began to downgrade at the endings. The VIPs were awfully bad and full of cringe dialogue of 9 year olds. As for the main lead actor of the show, he was not good in any aspect. The Pakistani guy was more likable than him. Except for one episode I don't think there is any scene in which the main lead actor is useful.
Great plot, great acting, and all around great show. One of the best series I've seen on netflix in a very long time. Korean cinema is absolutely the best with their story telling. 10/10!!

column4: the worst series I have ever watched
column5: The worst series I have ever watched. Very naive action and desperate acting.

column4: A hell of a rollercoaster ride
column5: Since I've recently finished the current season of the show, i thought I'd share my views here. I'd like to start off by saying that the show started off on a good note. I started watching it like pretty much everyone else, it created a lot of buzz on the Internet, so I thought it must be worth checking out. The concept of the show was itself good and for the most part, well executed. It took me back, since when I first started watching the show, I didn't know what to expect. I felt like the show did generally well with the character development and the plot, despite the little time it had. My primary criticism is aimed towards the aftermath from episode 6 of the show. The show was really a hell of a rollercoaster ride till that point. Like many others, I also disliked the portrayal of the VIPs. Their portrayal was more of an annoyance and a disturbance than anything else. They had weird accents and pronunciation, cheesy lines and way of talking. They served more to distract than add something to the plot. The final boss fight between Gi-hun and Sang-woo could also have been performed better. Sang-woo went down too easily. The detective's (presuming he survived) and his brother's storylines were left on a cliffhanger. Then the ending is the current and trending problem of the show. It left too many unanswered questions and it'd be disappointing for the show to end on such a note. If there are plans for a 2nd season, then it will have a lot of explaining to do: the organization, how Gi-hun was able to stay under the radar despite being filthy rich, the role of In-ho and etc.
It's simply one of the best thriller series I've ever seen. I'm starting to dig in the Korean TV series to find sth similar.

I personally don't like this type of shows, where people get locked in something , and they all die except one person. But, i liked it here because this time, it was different. It showed exactly why those people are in there, and i really like the choice they gave them, so everybody was in there because of their own will. They really did awesome description of every single main character, and why they choose to play the game. That is what kept me into the series, and why it is different from all the other shows like that.BUT, after episode 6, everything went downside in my opinion... Ending is just horrible, it has no meaning to why they did all of this ( i mean, that plot twist at the end was nothing special ), but fun... Common really.. . I feel like it is not that well described, it was fast explained , and put into half of episode, done really fast... That is just my opinion, otherwise great show , coming from person who does not like this types of show at all !

I just wish that they could find voice actors doing the English Audio that don't sound so dorky and that have some sort of acting training. The show was great and the idea was spectacular but the voice actors really made it hard to wanna keep watching. It's like they were trying to sound cheesy and Netflix was totally okay with that.
Just watch itI watch a million TV shows & moviesAnd I shoud say this is one of my best experiences.

column4: One of the best recent Netflix shows (switch the Korean audio)
column5: The voice actors are incredibly cringe in this show, it wasn't until episode 4 where I discovered I could change the audio to Korean within the Netflix settings. Makes it so much better.

column4: One of the Best Shows I've Ever Seen
column5: I've personally found the majority of Netflix's original content to be mediocre or uninteresting. Stranger Things was the last series that left a big impression on me (at least the first season lol). Now Squid Game's done it.A+ storytelling, character development, cinematography, set design, costume design, acting, writing, editing. It was so well done. I was pulled in from the start and invested in it as though it was all real. It's top tier entertainment, and it should be no surprise to anyone because of how well it's doing in both the US and the rest of the world. If it were as bad as other reviews might say, it wouldn't be getting so much social media buzz and definitely wouldn't be closing in as the most streamed Netflix series of all time. It's just that good. Not to discredit more critical reviews, but they're subjective. Nothings ever for everyone. But Squid Game has proven to be for most with its huge popularity.The credit for this show is the director/writer. He's a genius and had a lot of weight on him with making this, and I'm so glad Netflix picked his idea up after a decade of not finding anyone to help make this show. I watched this with my friend, and I'll be watching again with my family if they decide to see it too.I watched the Korean audio with English subtitles, and from what I've been seeing online, that's been the best way to watch it. It started playing automatically in English dub, and my friend and I were like "ehhh no" when we heard it. So glad we changed it.I can't wait to see a second season.

column4: Critical series! But the acting of the VIPs sucks
column5: One of the best making and a simple storyline but the message of human kind behaviour makes the story more interesting.

The plot is great, the acting is superb & the soundtrack is very neatly placed! Squid Game manages to shock, excite & pull your heart strings right from the get go. A must watch if you're up for some good time & aren't easily disturbed by some gore.

All the hype on social media made me sit and watch the serie - and yes, I expected something really gooood!I saw some comments online about the "message" of the serie and how good and educational it is and how this serie make us understand our mistakes and blah blah and I was expecting to see that - but let's be honest, the serie is b u l l s h i t!(Don't let me start on the bad acting :S).----From episode 1 to episode 10: The main character is some weak ass idiot that after all he went through he couldnt just get his shit together and get his daughther back! End of the movie :)I hope you dont waste 10 hours of tour life just like I did and I am so sorry about it!

column4: It's trash. I want 8 hours of my life back
column5: All the thumbs down. It's an inane, trite, heavy-handed slog that repeatedly insults the viewer's intelligence by having a character awkwardly explain scenes that just happened to nobody in particular.

column4: Rubbish, Senseless, worst ever content on internet
column5: Most rubbish thing i have ever watched in my life till date. Censorship on OTT platform is required to weed out such content.
Predictable and melodramatic to a fault. The treatment of the female characters was botched, the whole production felt unbelievably forced... And don't even get me started on the VIPs.
The challenge is to get the end without the need to shoot yourself in the head! Acting pretty cringeworthy and drawn out far too long! Nice cinema photography though!

column5: Plot is predictable. Nothing new to offer. Better movies are there in this genre.

column4: Ending strongly suggesting a serious 2 yay
column5: Nutshell gripping, easy to binge watch, Not suitable for kids. Very dark and enjoyable A tad predictable. But the games were fantastic to watch. Agree with many on here the last 2 episodes were a bit rushed . Overall brilliant 👏
Wow, I cannot believe this show! Ending was a bit????? But overall excellent great work Netflix.
I really enjoyed it and suggest this series to everyone I know! Perfect.

The story is great and has so much potential, but I just don't understand why they would give big clues about the ending plot in the middle of the season, although they still managed to put plots in each episode. The ending could be better but it's 100% worth watching and I'm already waiting for the second season lol.
The story, the motif is great, but the conversation, the acting between characters are so lame.It could be a cultural things that Koreans speak that way.Just my opinion. Take it or leave it.
One of the best series ive ever watched,i hope it gets renewed for second season.
I'm not really into films with dubbing but this was done well so you don't even notice. Probably up there with my favourite every series.
It's not a mind blowing series just a ok type series.the issue of this series is it's a boring series.starting was very slow and all those games are not interesting to watch.

With all the hype about this series, I thought this would be a fantastic series to watch.How disappointing it was, I stuck with it just waiting for something exciting to happen and to finally see why it was no. 1 on Netflix but that excitement never came. I was not sat on the edge of my seat nor did I long for the next episode to start.In fact, I must agree with the 10 producers and directors that refused to take this series on.And that woman's voice! It just shrieks through your head and rips your ears out until you have no eardrum left!!! The best part of this series was th titles at the end of the whole series. Thank god it finished, but I really regret starting it and being told it was something it's really not.My advice, give it a miss, You will just waste hours of your life for no good reason at all!

This series is beautifully produced and directed. So many stories with in itself and has drama, action, suspence. I couldn't stop watching it. I hope they do a second season, or add more episodes.Beware parents not for children, lots of death, gore, blood, simulated dead bodies, violence.
